I'm from Belgium, born on 9th of march 1981 and former president of LouvainLiNux, a belgian LUG. Everybody call me "Ploum" online. Sometimes even in real life, so please use this nickname ;-)

* My email is ploum at frimouvy.org (or zeploum at gmail.com )
* My Jabber ID is ploum at frimouvy.org (the same) 
* My blog : http://ploum.frimouvy.org  (<nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?en|English only]]</nowiki>)
* My CIA account : http://cia.vc/stats/author/ploum
* Linkedin : http://www.linkedin.com/in/dricotlionel
* Twitter : http://twitter.com/ploum
* Last.fm : http://www.last.fm/user/ploum

I'm an OpenSource Evangelist that like to write (in french, mostly), to talk in front of a large crowd an to travel. I'm the founder and administrator of fritalk.com Jabber server (more than 4000 accounts) and the writer of an <nowiki>[[http://www.eyrolles.com/Accueil/Livre/9782212120035/livre-ubuntu-efficace.php|Ubuntu french book]]</nowiki>. I studied Engineering at <nowiki>[[http://www.uclouvain.be|UCL]]</nowiki> in Belgium and I'm working as a research engineer.

{{http://ploum.frimouvy.org/images/livre.jpg}}

My favourites projects in the FLOSS world are Ubuntu (of course), Debian, GNOME, GStreamer and Jabber.
You've maybe seen me in the following communities : Ubuntu, Ubuntu-fr, Ubuntu-be, gnomefr, jabberfr, LouvainLiNux, Andesi,...

Besides OpenSource, my interests in life are Space & Astronomy, Technology, Martial Arts, Sports, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Literature|Literature]]</nowiki> and Travels around the world.

=== What have I done in the OpenSource world ? ===
(it won't be of any interest to you. I just want to keep tracks of what I did )

As from January 2008, I'm not a Ubuntu member anymore and I spend as less time as possible in front of my computer. I'm still a heavy Ubuntu enthousiast and I still do conferences from time to time. Please do not contact me anymore for technical stuffs.

2007 :
* I used to be an active member of http://forum.ubuntu-fr.org and http://ubuntuforums.org , helping newbies and writing howto.
* I maintained the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/LaptopTestingTeam/ToshibaSatelliteU200-163|Toshiba Satellite U200-163]]</nowiki> page and the related ThinkFinger howto. 
* Hacking and helping on the <nowiki>[[http://www.bongo-project.org/|Bongo]]</nowiki> mail & calendar server.
* Hacking on <nowiki>[[http://conseil.fritalk.com|Conseil Bug Triager]]</nowiki>
* On November 11, I spent the day with NicolasDaLuzDuque to install Ubuntu on the public computers of Infor Jeunes, Waterloo (Belgium)
* On October 31, I gave a conference at Louvain-la-Neuve (Belgium) to introduce Ubuntu and the benefits of Free Software Development.
* From Frebuary to June 2007, I hold a short weekly chronicle about free softwares on <nowiki>[[http://www.purefm.be/|PureFM radio]]</nowiki>
* On April 28, for <nowiki>[[http://www.installfest.info/FLISOL2007/|FLISOL 2007]]</nowiki>, I gave <nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?143-flisol-2007-in-guadalajara|a conference about Ubuntu and the Free Software world in Guadalajara]]</nowiki>, Mexico.
* I'm the editor of the Feisty Fawn "Linux Identity Set" Magazine (in French), Oxypress editions.
 
2006 : 
* On Novembre 14, I gave a conference at Louvain-la-Neuve, introducing more than 70 people to Ubuntu, Linux and Free Softwares. This was a Louvain-Li-Nux event.
* The second edition of my <nowiki>[[http://www.eyrolles.com/Accueil/Livre/9782212120035/livre-ubuntu-efficace.php|Ubuntu book]]</nowiki> is available ! Lot of new goodness including a CC licensed chapter about the command line (see <nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?124-ubuntu-efficace|the announce on my blog]]</nowiki> for more informations).
* As a Summer Of Code, I did the <nowiki>[[http://conseil.fritalk.com/conseil|Conseil]]</nowiki> software wich is an hard client interface against launchpad. Shame on me, it is not yet finished. It can read bugs but not modify them. I think I will not work on it before launchpad as true XML-RPC support.
* Bugs reporting and triaging in both Gnome and Ubuntu Bugzilla.
* Working on specifications for Dapper
* I wrote an article for <nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?2006/06/01/110-the-long-time-support-flying-car|6.06 LTS release]]</nowiki> (<nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?2006/06/01/111-la-voiture-volante-long-time-support|french translation]]</nowiki>)
* My <nowiki>[[http://www.eyrolles.com/Accueil/Livre/9782212116083/|book about Ubuntu]]</nowiki> is published, in french, at <nowiki>[[http://www.editions-eyrolles.com/Livre/9782212116083/|Eyrolles Editions]]</nowiki>. See <nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?2006/01/06/88-ubuntu-le-livre|my blog]]</nowiki> for more informations. It was a commerical success according to the editor.
* I was the official interviewer for FOSDEM. Interviews were published on the FOSDEM website.
* I've launched Ubuntu-be, the BelgianTeam at FOSDEM, making <nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?2006/03/01/97-it-s-a-long-way-to-the-top|a little speech]]</nowiki>. Ubuntu-be is now rocking thanks to a lof of very talented people, speaking a mix of both languages of our lovely country.
* My LUG and I organized an install party. Only 30 installation this time but it was still Breezy.
* I've launched the <nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?2006/04/06/103-may-19th-the-open-discussion-day-19-mai|Open Discussion Day]]</nowiki> which was <nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?2006/05/17/107-the-captive-clown|a success]]</nowiki>
* I did the official <nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?2006/02/23/96-say-hello-to-your-planet|sabdfl hackergotchi]]</nowiki> ! Not kidding, that's my greatest contribution so far.

2005 : 
* I wrote an article in french for <nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?2005/04/08/48-lhoary-ma-meilleure-amie|the hoary release]]</nowiki> and for <nowiki>[[http://ploum.frimouvy.org/?2005/10/13/73-breezy-pitez-vous|breezy release]]</nowiki>.
